title: Von Allmen wins downhill, 1st gold of Milan Cortina
content: Swiss racer Franjo von Allmen captured the Olympic downhill Saturday to win the first gold medal at the Milan Cortina Games.

title: Ex-MLB player Puig found guilty in gambling probe
content: A jury has found ex-major league outfielder Yasiel Puig guilty of obstruction of justice and lying to federal officials, the U.S. Attorney's Office said Friday.

title: Hall of Fame envisions changes after '26 outcry
content: Jim Porter said the Hall of Fame plans to return to in-person voting and that the vote will likely happen closer to the annual reveal at NFL Honors -- the Thursday before the Super Bowl.

title: Vonn completes training run, ready for downhill
content: Lindsey Vonn completed another successful training run Saturday on the eve of the race at the Milan Cortina Olympics little more than a week after tearing the ACL in her left knee.

title: Reverse? Brady backs Kraft, 'get that 7th ring'
content: Tom Brady, who was widely criticized this week after he said he didn't have a "dog in the fight" in Sunday's Super Bowl between the Patriots and Seahawks, indicated in a social media post Friday night that he is backing his former team.

title: St. John's tops UConn as Pitino ties No. 3 in wins
content: St. John's landed its first marquee win of the season Friday night, knocking off No. 3 UConn 81-72 to snap the Huskies' 18-game winning streak in front of an electric crowd at Madison Square Garden.

title: Ex-NFL LB Darron Lee charged in girlfriend's death
content: Former NFL linebacker Darron Lee, the Jets' first-round pick in 2016, was arrested and charged with first-degree murder in the death of his girlfriend, the Hamilton County (Tennessee) Sheriff's Office announced Friday.

title: 18% tariffs, agriculture protected: How India benefits from trade deal with US? Explained
content: India-US trade deal: India and the US have released a joint statement detailing the broad contours of the trade agreement that is expected to be signed in a few weeks. The trade deal is a big boost for India's exports. We decode the benefits:

title: Dan Ives to markets battering tech stocks - What he said on AI
content: Tech analyst Dan Ives and Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang are pushing back against Wall Street's fear that AI will make software companies obsolete. They argue that AI actually relies on software and presents opportunities for companies to innovate, not face extinction. Investors are reportedly overrating AI's disruptive potential, leading to unwarranted sell-offs in software giants.

title: Islamabad blast: ISIS affiliate claims responsibility for the attack that killed 36
content: The Islamic State has claimed responsibility for a deadly suicide bombing at a Shiite mosque in Islamabad, which killed at least 36. The group stated Shiites are a target, citing their involvement in fighting ISIS in Syria. Authorities have arrested several suspects, including the alleged mastermind, as investigations into the attacker's background, including time spent in Afghanistan, continue.

title: Ukraine-Russia peace deal by June? What Zelenskyy said about US deadline
content: The United States has set a June deadline for Ukraine and Russia to end their nearly four-year conflict, with President Zelenskyy indicating the Trump administration will exert pressure to meet this timeline.  Ukraine confirmed participation in upcoming trilateral talks, likely in Miami, following recent Russian strikes that forced nuclear power plants to reduce output due to attacks on energy infrastructure.

title: T20 WC: Why Sanju Samson is not in India's playing XI against USA
content: Sanju Samson was omitted from India's T20 World Cup 2026 opening XI against the USA. Ishan Kishan takes his place at the top, with Suryakumar Yadav confirming the changes. Jasprit Bumrah is also out due to illness, replaced by Mohammed Siraj.  Washington Sundar also missed out.

title: Elon Musk denies Starlink phone: CEO says no device in works
content: Elon Musk has officially denied reports of SpaceX developing a Starlink phone, stating "We are not developing a phone." This clarification comes amidst speculation about the satellite internet business's expansion ahead of a potential IPO. Musk has previously expressed strong reluctance towards phone manufacturing.

title: Why is Jasprit Bumrah not playing India's T20 World Cup opener?
content: India‚Äôs T20 World Cup opener against the USA began with Jasprit Bumrah ruled out due to illness, with Mohammed Siraj replacing him. USA won the toss and chose to bowl on a batting-friendly Wankhede pitch. Suryakumar Yadav admitted pressure but backed India‚Äôs approach, while Monank Patel expressed confidence in his team. India and USA named strong XIs as India began their title defence.

title: When music turns into prayer: Inside the world of 'bhajan concerts'
content: Devotional music concerts are experiencing a surge in popularity, attracting younger audiences with their blend of spiritual chants and contemporary arrangements.  These gatherings offer a unique, immersive experience, fostering community and emotional grounding amidst urban life.  Prime Minister Modi even highlighted this growing trend, calling it 'bhajan-clubbing,' as traditional practices find new relevance.

title: T20 World Cup: Pakistan contemplating U-turn? PCB begins dialogue with ICC
content: The PCB has invoked Force Majeure citing the government instruction to not take the field versus their arch-rivals in the group stage of the multi-nation tournament. In the statement, the government didn't give any further explanation or justification for doing the same. India are schedule to play Pakistan on February 15.

title: ‚ÄòIn 36 months, the cheapest place to put AI will be ‚Ä¶‚Äô: Musk makes a bold prediction
content: Elon Musk predicts space will become the most cost-effective location for AI data centers within three years. He cited advantages like five times greater solar panel efficiency, no need for batteries due to constant sunlight, and the absence of atmospheric interference.

title: Ghaziabad sisters‚Äô suicide: Father has 3 wives; police reveal what happened on night of tragedy
content: Three minor sisters in Ghaziabad died after jumping from their ninth-floor apartment, with preliminary findings suggesting emotional distress linked to family issues and confiscated mobile phones. The girls, aged 16, 14, and 12, were reportedly upset after their father took away their phones due to their attachment to Korean culture. Investigations are ongoing, examining family dynamics and the father's past.

title: Is home-cooked food always healthy?
content: Home-cooked meals are often perceived as the healthiest choice, fostering trust and comfort. While generally true due to fewer preservatives and greater control over ingredients, this isn't always the case. Unhealthy cooking methods and imbalanced meals at home can still pose risks. Experts emphasize the importance of balanced ingredients and variety for truly beneficial homemade diets.

title: Anna Kupp breaks silence with heartfelt note ahead of Super Bowl 2026
content: Cooper Kupp, the Seattle Seahawks' star player, seems to be fully focused for Super Bowl LX on Sunday as he gears up to take the field against the New England Patriots in Levi Stadium, California. Amid this, his wife, Anna, has shared a few words that reflect how the family is gearing up for the big day and how she is supporting him.

title: Precision oncology in cancer care: Doctors explain why it matters today
content: Cancer treatment is evolving beyond a one-size-fits-all approach. Precision oncology analyzes a tumor's genetic makeup to tailor treatments, offering more effective therapies with fewer side effects. This personalized strategy aims to improve patient outcomes and provide more informed care by matching the right treatment to the right patient at the right time.

title: ‚ÄòTamil is India‚Äôs link to world‚Äô: PM to Indian diaspora in Malaysia; what's on agenda
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi highlighted the strong cultural and emotional ties between India and Malaysia during his interaction with the Indian diaspora in Kuala Lumpur. He praised the community for preserving traditions and acknowledged Malaysia's significant Indian-origin population as a "living bridge." Modi also emphasised the global importance of the Tamil language and culture.

title: Suicide pact? 4 Jain pilgrims from Karnataka found dead at Bihar ‚Äòdharamshala‚Äô
content: Four Jain pilgrims from Karnataka were found dead in a locked room at a Rajgir dharamshala. Police suspect suicide after discovering sleeping pills and a foul smell. The family had been in the room, locked from the inside, since February 2nd.

title: From 98/2 to 114/7: How Pakistan's T20 World Cup nearly ended on day one
content: Pakistan narrowly avoided a T20 World Cup 2026 opening upset against the Netherlands, thanks to a match-winning 29 off 11 balls from Faheem Ashraf.  Chasing 148, Pakistan collapsed in the middle order, but Ashraf's explosive 19th over turned the tide, securing a three-wicket victory with three balls to spare.

title: 'Khejri Bachao Andolan': Why Rajasthan is rallying to protect its 'Kalpavriksha'?
content: A significant protest is under way in Rajasthan over the felling of the khejri tree. Communities are demanding stronger protection for the state tree, alleging that it is being cut to make way for solar power projects. Political leaders across parties have joined the movement, drawing attention to the tree‚Äôs cultural and ecological significance. In an arid landscape where survival is closely tied to ecology, the debate in western Rajasthan now extends beyond development to questions of history, identity and survival.

title: Taylor Swift‚Äôs ‚ÄòOpalite‚Äô video fuels Kelce theories
content: ‚ÄãTaylor Swift once again showed why her creative choices rarely stay limited to music alone. On Friday, the pop superstar surprised fans by releasing the music video for her hit single Opalite, and the response was immediate. As Swift continues to dominate headlines while being closely linked to the NFL through her engagement to Kansas City Chiefs star Travis Kelce, the video quickly became a talking point for both Swifties and football fans.

title: Mumbai horror: 40-year-old man arrested for sexually assaulting female dog
content: A 40-year-old man has been arrested by Samta Nagar Police for allegedly sexually assaulting a female dog in Kandivali East. A social worker discovered the injured animal and reported the incident. The FIR was registered under the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals Act and the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita.

title: Vaibhav Sooryavanshi can't play for India right now ‚Äì Here's why
content: Fourteen-year-old Vaibhav Sooryavanshi's record-shattering 175 in the U19 World Cup final against England has ignited debate about his senior India debut.  Despite his phenomenal performance, the ICC's Minimum Age Policy, requiring players to be 15, and the BCCI's 'One-Tournament' rule for U19s, currently prevent his inclusion.  Fans eagerly await his transition to the senior squad.

title: From agriculture to auto: What each sector got in India-US trade deal
content: India and the US have agreed on an interim trade framework, outlining tariff cuts and market access for manufacturing and industrial goods, while safeguarding sensitive agricultural and dairy sectors. This pact aims to ease trade tensions and pave the way for a broader Bilateral Trade Agreement.

title: T20 WC: Ahead of match against USA, Hardik says 'want to scare everyone'
content: Ahead of India's T20 World Cup opener, all-rounder Hardik Pandya expressed confidence and motivation, believing his international journey is just beginning. He aims to win at least four to five more ICC trophies for India, stating his potential as a batter will become "really scary" in the coming years.

title: 'Chakka marna inka style nahi hai': Babar trolled on-air - Watch
content: Pakistan narrowly beat the Netherlands by three wickets in their T20 World Cup opener after a tense chase led by Faheem Ashraf‚Äôs late heroics. During the match, ex-India cricketer Mohammad Kaif mocked Babar Azam‚Äôs batting style on commentary, saying hitting sixes isn‚Äôt his strength. Pakistan captain Salman Agha praised Faheem, while the Dutch rued missed chances.

title: 'Said he would reach in 10mins': How Delhi biker '200 metres from home' fell into killer pit
content: In a heartbreaking turn of events in Janakpuri, 25-year-old call centre worker Kamal Dhyani was found dead in a construction pit. Just moments before he went missing, he had assured his family he was only ten minutes from home. His motorcycle was located nearby, raising serious questions about community safety and the response time to his prior lack of communication.

title: T20 WC: Faheem Ashraf scripts thrilling Pakistan escape against Netherlands
content: Faheem Ashraf's explosive unbeaten 29 off 11 balls secured a dramatic three-wicket victory for Pakistan against the Netherlands in their T20 World Cup opener.  Despite a mid-innings collapse, Ashraf's late heroics, including three sixes in the penultimate over, guided Pakistan to 148 with three balls to spare, rescuing them from a precarious position.

title: 'Mary Kom' actor Sunil Thapa passes away at the age of 68
content: Veteran actor Sunil Thapa has passed away in Kathmandu at 68 following a suspected heart attack. Renowned for his extensive work in Nepali, Bhojpuri, and Bollywood cinema, including a notable role in Priyanka Chopra's 'Mary Kom', Thapa's career spanned over four decades and more than 300 films.

title: North Korea executes teens for watching Squid Game and listening to K-Pop
content: Shocking testimony reveals North Koreans, including students, face execution for watching South Korean shows like Squid Game and listening to K-pop.  Amnesty International reports severe punishments, including death, for consuming foreign media.  New laws mandate harsh penalties, with executions serving as 'ideological education' to deter citizens from foreign cultural influences.

title: 'Golden letter day': Piyush Goyal hails India-US trade deal; reiterates farmers protected
content: India and the US have inked a landmark trade deal, a significant stride towards India's developed nation status by 2047. Union Minister Piyush Goyal highlighted the agreement's aim to boost bilateral trade to $500 billion, securing benefits for farmers and exporters with reduced tariffs, including zero duty on key sectors like gems, diamonds, and pharmaceuticals.

title: ‚ÄòLost balance‚Äô: UP woman accidentally hangs herself while shooting Instagram reel, dies
content: A 27-year-old woman in Uttar Pradesh died while filming an Instagram reel where she pretended to hang herself. Mohini lost her balance while standing on a stool, causing the noose to tighten fatally around her neck. The tragic accident was discovered by her young daughter.

title: Message to Pak? Amid trade pact, India's map shared by Trump aide grabs attention
content: A US trade representative's map, released alongside an interim trade agreement framework, correctly depicts the entirety of Jammu and Kashmir and Aksai Chin as part of India. This marks a departure from previous US maps and aligns with India's stance, potentially signaling a shift in US policy towards Pakistan and China.

title: Hit first, ask questions later: India's new-age batting faces its T20 World Cup test
content: India's T20 World Cup batting philosophy has shifted to aggressive acceleration, prioritising high strike-rates and minimal settling-in time. This tournament will test their new-age approach, featuring specialist T20 batters like Abhishek Sharma and Rinku Singh, aiming for decisive Powerplay wins and controlled finishes.

title: Interior expert shares homes design trends no longer in vogue and what has replaced them
content: Indian homes are shifting from predictable, trend-driven design to spaces with depth and personal meaning. Homeowners are embracing warmth over coldness, character over coordination, and lived-in elegance. Trends like all-white walls, strict symmetry, and cool grays are giving way to layered colors, asymmetrical balance, and earthy tones, creating more welcoming and authentic living environments.

title: WWE SmackDown 6-Feb-2026: Chamber qualifiers, Liv Morgan returns, Oba Femi debuts
content: SmackDown featured Elimination Chamber qualifiers where Tiffany Stratton and Randy Orton secured their spots.  Undisputed WWE Champion Drew McIntyre was confronted by Cody Rhodes, while Oba Femi made an impactful main roster debut.  Rhea Ripley and IYO Sky retained their Women's Tag Team titles.

title: 'Forced to consume alcohol': On way to exams, class 8 girl gangraped by 4 in Madhya Pradesh
content: A Class 8 student was gangraped by four men in Mauganj district on her way to school exams. The accused allegedly administered an intoxicant before leaving her unconscious in a forest. She regained consciousness the next day and narrated her ordeal to the police, leading to the arrest of all four accused.

title: Exclusive: 'Until he plays Tests, he isn‚Äôt a big 'cricketer'‚ÄîSooryavanshi‚Äôs father
content: Vaibhav Sooryavanshi smoked 15 sixes and 15 fours at a strike rate of 218.75 during a brutal and breathtaking knock in the U-19 World Cup final against England at the Harare Sports Club in Zimbabwe. Back home in his village in Bihar‚Äôs Samastipur district, his family had hardly caught any sleep, while his coach‚Äôs phone in Patna was buzzing with congratulatory messages and strange requests: ‚ÄúSir, mera beta do saal ka hai, usko cricketer Vaibhav bana dijiye (My son is two years old, make him like Vaibhav).‚Äù

title: Man lost wife to Indore water tragedy, dies in hospital 40 days later
content: A 70-year-old man has died just weeks after his wife succumbed to diarrhoea. Both illnesses were linked to contaminated water in Bhagirathpura. The man's family is now mourning two losses in 40 days. The district administration had previously compensated the family for the wife's death. The water contamination crisis has affected thousands in the area.

content: Acknowledging it is difficult to give precise answers, Chief Economic Adviser V Anantha Nageswaran warned on Saturday that AI advancements put coding and cognitive jobs at risk, which will inevitably affect hiring trends.

content: Bangladesh General Election 2026: On August 8, 2024, Yunus, Bangladesh's Nobel Peace Prize-winning economist, took office as the interim chief adviser of the country.

title: How Shoes Led To Arrest Of Cunning Chain Snatcher In Mumbai
content: A single individual has been identified as the mastermind behind a series of chain-snatching incidents that recently hit Mumbai and Navi Mumbai. Police have arrested 49-year-old Mohan Kokate, a resident of Mumbai's Sion area.

title: Rupee To Be Big Beneficiary Of India-US Trade Deal: Chief Economic Adviser
content: The Indian rupee is going to be one of the big beneficiaries of the India-US trade deal, Chief Economic Adviser V Anantha Nageswaran believes, as the country gears up for wider access to key American markets.

title: PM Modi Shares Car Ride With Malaysian Counterpart On Way To Community Meet
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday shared a car ride with his Malaysian counterpart, Anwar Ibrahim, following the former's arrival in Malaysia as part of his two-day visit in the Southeast Asian nation.

title: Foreign Ministry To Answer Question On Russian Oil Purchase: Piyush Goyal
content: Union Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal on Saturday said the Ministry of External Affairs will give information about India's purchase of Russian oil.

title: Opinion: Opinion | US-India Trade: Why the Interim Agreement Is A Vital Reset
content: After months of escalating tensions and ongoing negotiations, the United States and India announced an interim trade agreement, with a final comprehensive accord expected in March.

title: After 30 Years In Jail In Rs 20 Case, Man Found Innocent. He Dies Next Day
content: It was a real life Shawshank Redemption of sorts, but one with an ending that would have been much nicer if the person had lived a little longer.

title: 3 Sisters Married Same Man. Their 3 Daughters Loved Father More, Koreans Most
content: The investigation into the suicide by three sisters, all under 16, in Uttar Pradesh's Ghaziabad keeps going deeper down a rabbit hole. Previously unknown facts have come out now.

title: Delhi Jal Board Admits Negligence In Preliminary Report On Biker's Death
content: The Delhi Jal Board (DJB) investigation committee has prepared its preliminary report on the death of the biker who fell into a construction pit in the Janakpuri area of Delhi on Friday morning.

title: Can Rahul Gandhi Quote From Book In Parliament? Experts' Take On Massive Row
content: The parliament standoff has brought into focus Rule 349 of the Rules of Procedure and Conduct of Business in Lok Sabha, cited by Speaker Om Birla while rejecting Rahul Gandhi's insistence to quote General Naravane's unpublished book.

title: Madhya Pradesh May Seek More Time From Top Court In Minister's Remarks Case
content: The Madhya Pradesh government is likely to seek more time from the Supreme Court to take a final call on granting prosecution sanction against state cabinet minister Vijay Shah, sources indicated on Saturday.

title: 2 Tragedies, A Month Apart. Husband, Wife Die Due To Water Contamination
content: Indore's Bhagirathpura did not just lose water quality. It lost an entire family's sense of safety ... slowly, thirteen days at a time. On December 28, seventy-year-old Urmila Yadav died after suffering bouts of vomiting and diarrhoea.

title: 'Such Pits Should Not Remain In Future': Delhi Biker's Father
content: The father of 25-year-old biker Kamal Dhyani, who died after falling into a Delhi Jal Board (DJB) open pit in Janakpur,i expressed dissatisfaction with the Delhi government and demanded accountability.

content: Jeffrey Epstein's sphere of influence among businessmen, politicians and academics also reached India, with the disgraced financier spending years cultivating a relationship with a scion of the nation's wealthiest family.

title: 'Drug Delivery In 5 Minutes': Punjab Congress's Big Charge, AAP Hits Back
content: Former Punjab Chief Minister Charanjit Singh Channi has once again slammed the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) government over the drug menace in the state, releasing a video that claims narcotics are now being delivered to users within minutes.

title: Sonia Gandhi Terms Plea Over Voter List Inclusion Politically Motivated
content: Sonia Gandhi has informed the Rouse Avenue Court that allegations regarding the purported fraudulent inclusion of her name in the voter list before obtaining Indian citizenship are "politically motivated" and devoid of merit.

content: the best of the NFL gathered at the Palace of Fine Arts in San Francisco for Thursday's Super Bowl honors . the Seattle Seahawks and new England Patriots meet at Levi's Stadium in Santa Clara, California, for super bowl lX . quarterback Matthew Stafford won the biggest prize -- MVP .

title: Milan Cortina Olympics: Best from Saturday
content: The 2026 Milan Cortina Olympics have begun, following a stunning  opening ceremony  that welcomed fans to the Games. Ilia Malinin, the two-time world champion, will make his Olympic debut in figure skating's second day of the team event. The U.S. is currently in the points lead after the first day. The U.S. women's ice hockey team, which beat Czechia 5-1 on Thursday, will take on Finland in the morning. KEY EVENTS (all times ET) 10:40 a.m.: Women's ice hockey (USA vs. Finland) 1:30 p.m.: Men's snowboard (big air final) 1:45 p.m.: Men's figure skating team event (men's singles short program, ice dance free dance) MORE:   Medal tracker  |  Full schedule of events  |  Olympics 101 Here are the top moments from Saturday's events.

title: Bonded labour persists as modern-day slavery despite five-decade-old law
content: This may be the 21st century, but the scourge of slavery is still a reality. Inequality, brutality, and dehumanisation have taken new forms in various workplaces, once again targeting the marginalised, with migrant workers added to the painful mix. The poor are still forced to work in inhuman conditions without wages and are subjected to verbal abuse and caste-based discrimination. On February 9, the Bonded Labour System (Abolition) Act will turn 50. Despite the Act and efforts to abolish bonded labour, Tamil Nadu still finds that the system of ‚Äòmodern-day slavery‚Äô remains alive and kicking. While the State has made considerable efforts to rescue bonded labourers and file cases, delayed justice and inadequate rehabilitation continue to undermine the Act, pointing to the need for far stronger implementation, finds Meghna M.

title: India trusted partner for growth, says PM Modi in Malaysia citing trade deals with various countries
content: ‚ÄúTrust has become India‚Äôs strongest currency,‚Äù Mr. Modi said, citing trade deals with the UK, UAE, Australia, New Zealand, Oman, the EU and the U.S.
